column4: Climate Neutrality (2040 target under discussion)
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG emissions sub-theme because it directly addresses the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, which is a key aspect of climate change mitigation.

column4: The total quantity of allowances for the new emissions trading system should follow a linear trajectory to reach the emission reduction target for 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG emissions sub-theme because it discusses the reduction of emissions through the emissions trading system.

column4: Achieve an EU net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF) sector
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG removal sub-theme because it focuses on the removal of greenhouse gases from the atmosphere.

column4: Achieve a climate-resilient society status, fully adapted to the unavoidable impacts of climate change
column5: This target is assigned to the Climate Resilience sub-theme because it addresses the need for societies to adapt to the impacts of climate change.

column4: Renewable hydrogen will be key to replace natural gas, coal and oil in hard-to-decarbonise industries and transport
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable energy sub-theme because it discusses the use of renewable hydrogen as a substitute for fossil fuels.

column4: Bring online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025 and 600 GW by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable energy - Solar sub-theme because it specifically addresses the deployment of solar photovoltaic energy.

column2: Renewable energy - Offshore Wind and Ocean Energy
column4: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 60 GW of offshore wind by 2030 and at least 300 GW by 2050
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable energy - Offshore Wind and Ocean Energy sub-theme because it discusses the development of offshore wind energy.

column4: Member States shall ensure that the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin used for final energy and non-energy purposes shall be at least 42% of the hydrogen used for final energy and non-energy purposes in industry by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable energy - Renewable Hydrogen sub-theme because it addresses the use of renewable hydrogen in industry.

column4: Reduce buildings' final energy consumption by 14%
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy efficiency sub-theme because it aims to reduce energy consumption in buildings.

column4: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy efficiency - Buildings renovation sub-theme because it specifically addresses the renovation of buildings to improve energy efficiency.

column4: Each Member State shall increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector by at least 0.8 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2025
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Infrastructure sub-theme because it discusses the development of renewable energy infrastructure for heating and cooling.

column4: Ensure that energy poor and vulnerable consumers have access to solar energy
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy neutrality in wastewater sub-theme because it addresses the issue of energy access for vulnerable consumers.

column4: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1.9% each year
column5: This target is assigned to the Social Security sub-theme because it aims to reduce energy consumption in public bodies.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste
column5: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials sub-theme because it discusses the reduction of waste, which is related to the critical raw materials issue.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Producers of portable batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries
column5: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials - Batteries recycling sub-theme because it specifically addresses the recycling of batteries.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy

column4: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, is able to produce at least 15% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: This target is assigned to the Critical Raw Materials - Extraction and imports sub-theme because it discusses the extraction and importation of critical raw materials.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Double its circular material use rate in the coming decade
column5: This target is assigned to the Circular Economy sub-theme because it aims to increase the circular material use rate.

column5: This target is assigned to the Circular Economy - Vehicles circularity sub-theme because it discusses the recovery of vehicles.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: By 2030, manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union’s annual deployment needs
column5: This target is assigned to the Industrial Strategy sub-theme because it discusses the development of manufacturing capacity for net-zero technologies.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste
column5: This target is assigned to the Plastic and other packaging sub-theme because it specifically addresses the issue of plastic packaging.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column5: This target is assigned to the Food Waste sub-theme because it aims to reduce food waste.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: All batteries incorporated in market products shall be readily removable and replaceable by the end-user at any time during the lifetime
column5: This target is assigned to the Sustainable carbon cycles sub-theme because it discusses the issue of battery removability and replaceability.

column4: The amendments in Dir. 2023/2413 are also intended to support the achievement of the Union’s target of an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Hydrogen sub-theme because it discusses the production of sustainable biomethane.

column4: For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable and low-carbon fuels sub-theme because it discusses the use of zero-emission vehicles.

column4: Build three million public electric charging points by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Electric Vehicle Infrastructure sub-theme because it specifically addresses the development of electric vehicle charging infrastructure.

column4: Member States shall ensure that at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029
column5: This target is assigned to the Electrification of non-road transport sub-theme because it discusses the electrification of non-road transport.

column4: The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles, other than special purpose, off-road, off-road special purpose, and vocational vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019
column5: This target is assigned to the Decarbonisation of road transport sub-theme because it discusses the reduction of CO2 emissions from road transport.

column4: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Intermodality sub-theme because it discusses the reduction of fuel intensity in fisheries.

column4: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90%
column5: This target is assigned to the GHG Emissions sub-theme because it aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the transport sector.

column4: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Fuel intensity in fisheries sub-theme because it specifically addresses the reduction of fuel intensity in fisheries.

column4: The multimodal Trans-European Transport Network (TEN-T) equipped for sustainable and smart transport with high speed connectivity will be operational for the core network, by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the TEN-T sub-theme because it discusses the development of the TEN-T network.

column4: 1.a Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's land area
column5: This target is assigned to the Habitats Restoration sub-theme because it discusses the protection of land area.

column4: 1.b Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's sea area
column5: This target is assigned to the Habitats protection sub-theme because it specifically addresses the protection of sea area.

column4: Cities with at least 20.000 inhabitants have an ambitious Urban Greening Plan
column5: This target is assigned to the Urban Ecosystems sub-theme because it discusses the issue of urban greening plans.

column4: The decline of pollinators is reversed
column5: This target is assigned to the Pollinators sub-theme because it addresses the issue of pollinator decline.

column4: When identifying and implementing the restoration measures to meet the objectives and obligations set out in Articles 4, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10, Member States shall aim to contribute to the commitment of planting at least three billion additional trees by 2030 at Union level
column5: This target is assigned to the Forests ecosystems sub-theme because it discusses the issue of tree planting.

column4: Member States shall put in place measures which shall aim to achieve an increasing trend at national level of at least two out of the three following indicators in agricultural ecosystems
column5: This target is assigned to the Agricultural ecosystems sub-theme because it addresses the issue of agricultural ecosystem trends.

column4: The risk and use of chemical pesticides is reduced by 50%, and the use of more hazardous pesticides is reduced by 50%
column5: This target is assigned to the Pesticides and fertilisers sub-theme because it discusses the reduction of pesticide use.

column4: There is a 50% reduction in the number of Red List species threatened by invasive alien species
column5: This target is assigned to the Invasive Alien Species sub-theme because it addresses the issue of invasive alien species.

column4: Restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods
column5: This target is assigned to the Soil sub-theme because it discusses the issue of soil restoration.

column4: The negative impacts on sensitive species and habitats, including on the seabed through fishing and extraction activities, are substantially reduced
column5: This target is assigned to the Fisheries and Aquacultures sub-theme because it addresses the issue of fishing and extraction impacts.
